Detailed Description

The file content element is the base element of a file content structure. Javascript file content and XSL file content is based on a structure file content.

void FileContentElement::remove ( int  index  )  [protected]

Remove an element from the child list. The signal aboutToRemove() and removed() is emited while deleting the line index.

FileContentElement * FileContentElement::append ( FileContentElement *  element  )  [protected]

Append an element at the end of the list. Signals, aboutToAdd() and added() is emited while adding the element element. If the element is already in the list, the elements is not added but updated and the signal updated() is emited.

void FileContentElement::clear (  )  [protected]

Remove all elements from the list.

FileContentElement * FileContentElement::contains ( FileContentElement *  element  )  [protected]

Search if the list contains the element element. The test is made using method equals(). If the list contains the element, a pointer to the element is returned, else NULL, is returned.

Mark this element to be deleted by method removeMarkedDeleted().

Mark the element to be keeped and ignored by removeMarkedDeleted().

void FileContentElement::markAllDeleted (  )  [protected]

Mark all child element to be deleted by method removeMarkedDeleted().

void FileContentElement::removeMarkedDeleted (  )  [protected]

Remove from the child list all elements marked to be deleted by markDeleted().
